author: kaz
msg: Temporarily commenting out the table in the sample APT doc that is part
of the touchstone as it produces an xdoc that our site.jsl can't handle.
It uses an attribute in the <tr> element, this causes Jelly to bork.

author: kaz
msg: The addition of a sample APT doc to the touchstone build.  This is being
added to assist the debugging of a tha APT plugin which contains a
preGoal that is not being run.  Specifically, the APT plugin has this
snippet of jelly in its plugin.jelly script:
<preGoal name="xdoc:transform">
<attainGoal name="apt:generate"/>
</preGoal>
This used to force the generation of APT docs whenever any target that
invoked 'xdoc:transform' was run; however, recently something changed
and the 'apt:generate' goal is no longer run unless the 'xdoc:transform'
is run directly (vs indirectly as the result of the 'xdoc' or
'site:generate' goals).
By adding the APT doc to the touchstone, this will allow others to
experience the same problem I am having at the moment.  In addition, by
adding this document, I also bring to light a JSL issue.  It seems that
any xdoc with a <tr> element that has an attribute causes the build
process to choke.  The APT plugin by default generates <tr> elements
with the 'valign="top"' attribute set.  Granted, these attributes are
ignored by the current xdoc standard, but it is nonetheless an issue
with our JSL stylesheet that will need to be corrected.
